name: Writers Turned Screenwriters Online Trivia | Directors & Writers | 10 Questions

questions.text: "The Misfits" is an original screenplay by one of America's best playwrights. Which one?
questions.explanation:
Arthur Miller.

	It's a curiously unsatisfying piece - but it's interesting because of the cast:  Marilyn Monroe (in her last completed movie) while her marriage to Miller was falling apart, and Clark Gable in his last film role - he died shortly after completion of the picture.

questions.text: Evan Hunter is a successful novelist; he also wrote the screenplay for a Hitchcock classic. Which one?
questions.explanation:
The Birds.

	Hunter has written many novels as Hunter and as Ed McBain; he's also had some of his novels turned into movies. "Birds" was a very fine screenplay effort (from the Daphne DuMaurier short story).

questions.text: The quirky "western" "Night of the Hunter" featured a screenplay by James Agee. Who was the star of the movie?
questions.explanation:
Robert Mitchum.

	Agee, best known for "A Death in the Family" wrote the screenplay to this decidedly strange story. (Robert Mitchum has "Love" and "Hate" written across his fingers.)

questions.text: "The Big Sleep" included screenplay work by what author?
questions.explanation:
William Faulkner.

	Perhaps that's why the plot is so damned hard to follow.

questions.text: F. Scott Fitzgerald worked on the screenplay version of the novel, "The Three Comrades". Who wrote the novel?
questions.explanation:
Erich Maria Remarque.

	Remarque did more than merely write the classic "All Quiet on the Western Front".

questions.text: What writer worked on the screenplay version of Lillian Hellman's play "Watch on the Rhine"?
questions.explanation:
Dashiell Hammett.

	Hammett and Hellman had a long personal relationship.

questions.text: Playwright Anthony Shaffer wrote the screenplay for what Hitchcock movie?
questions.explanation:
Frenzy.

	Shaffer wrtote the superb "Sleuth". This effort, however was not the best - for him or for Hitch.

questions.text: Raymond Chandler wrote the screenplay for what classic movie?
questions.explanation:
Double Indemnity.

	Chandler wrote many tales about detective Philip Marlowe - but this wasn't one of them. (Nice job, though.)

questions.text: Harold Pinter wrote the screenplay for which of these novels by John Fowles?
questions.explanation:
The French Lieutenant's Woman.

	Fowles is often a fascinating writer: "The Magus" is quite interesting and ""The Collector" is also a good read. "Lieutenant" didn't read well (in my opinion) - and the movie (again, my opinion) was tough going. (Of course, Pinter is Pinter ...)

questions.text: A novel isn't always adapted into a screenplay by someone other than the original novelist. An example of this is "Mildred Pierce". Who was the author and screenwriter?
questions.explanation:
James M. Cain

	I haven't read the novel, but the movie was solid.
